channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12558] Disable TestHCM.testClusterStatus Unexpected exception, expected<org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RegionServerStoppedException> but was<junit.framework.AssertionFailedError>
item.description:
Happens for me reliably on mac os x. I looked at fixing it. The listener is not noticing the publish for whatever reason. Thats where I stopped.


java.lang.Exception: Unexpected exception, expected<org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RegionServerStoppedException> but was<junit.framework.AssertionFailedError>

	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:57)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:193)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitFor(HBaseTestingUtility.java:3537)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHCM.testClusterStatus(TestHCM.java:273)
item.summary: Disable TestHCM.testClusterStatus Unexpected exception, expected<org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RegionServerStoppedException> but was<junit.framework.AssertionFailedError>

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Stack,
it did not fail after hbase-12359, but fail now?

It did fail after I applied the patch – it had moved to a new failure type.

Looks like we see this issue too on occasion up on apache jenkins, probably dependent on which machine we run on. I could spend more time on this but will likely just disable this test of a rarely used feature unless someone is interested in working on it.

I just tried it and previous it was failing reliably, and now it is passing reliably – ugh!

Thanks Qiang Tian

interesting...
timing issue? perhaps 10s is not long enough?
I can take a look if it happens again..(log, stacktrace etc.)

It just happened here: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/11820//testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client/TestHCM/testClusterStatus/ Thanks Qiang Tian (I like what you are doing over in HBASE-11902)

still looking..(and the UT failure in 11902)
thanks.
Thanks Qiang Tian When I was looking at it, the server was publishing the message but listener never got it.

As you mentioned, in good case the listener receives the notification and write "There is a new dead server" in log.
2 possible cases for bad run:
1)the publisher does not collect data (looks not possible, just in case. log a debug message for it)
2)the publisher fail to send to client..(things handled by netty, add the same change to listener code..)

let's see what will happen..
Applied the patch to master Qiang Tian Lets see what happens.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5819 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5819/)
